model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: No, we rode a lot of rides that broke down.  We had to be rescued from the Pirates of the Caribbean ride.  It was stuck.  Someone put on waders and pushed us to the side to climb out.

MEMORY:
1. Speaker A loves Disney music.
2. Speaker A enjoys going to museums and trying different foods.
3. Speaker A is interested in music concerts and planning a trip to Sao Paulo.
4. Speaker A used to live in Los Angeles.
5. Speaker B has seen Three Dog Night in concert and enjoys their live shows.
6. Speaker B is waiting for bands to announce their summer tour schedule to plan which shows to attend.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: No, we rode a lot of rides that broke down.  We had to be rescued from the Pirates of the Caribbean ride.  It was stuck.  Someone put on waders and pushed us to the side to climb out.

speaker: Parent
raw_prediction: Oh wow, that must have been quite the experience! Good thing you made it out safely. Hopefully, your next visit to a Disney park will have smoother rides and maybe even catch a live music performance.
prediction:

Judgement: "No"
